Class Encoder

java.lang.Object
Encoder
public class Encoder
extends java.lang.Object
Encoder class. Create an instance off to encode a file that can be decoded with Decoder Class. Operate through dynamic methods: "encodeByteToBuffer", "getNextByte", "hasNextByte" and "flush". Use static method "parseStringAsBinaryByte" to convert a string of 1s and 0s into an integer.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Zdenek Plesek

    Encoder​(TreeNode rootNode)
    Constructor for the Encoder Class.

  • Constructor Details

    • Encoder

      public Encoder​(TreeNode rootNode)
      Constructor for the Encoder Class.
      Parameters:
      rootNode - : TreeNode, root node of the Huffman tree to be used for encoding.

  • Method Details

    • encodeByteToBuffer

      public void encodeByteToBuffer​(java.lang.Integer arg)
      Use this method to populate buffer with values representing bits which represent byte passed as argument.
      Parameters:
      arg - : Integer, integer representing the last read byte. Behaviour for integers non-defined in the tree is undefined.

    • hasNextByte

      public boolean hasNextByte()
      Use this method to discover whether next byte is ready to written.
      Returns:
      boolean, true if next byte is read, false if buffer isn't populated with 8 bits yet.

    • getNextByte

      public java.lang.String getNextByte()
      Use this method to obtain the next byte to be written. The byte is returned in the form of String of 1s and 0s.
      Returns:
      String, String of 1s and 0s representing the next byte.

    • flush

      public java.lang.String[] flush()
      This method should be called before writing is finished. It encodes eof symbol into the buffer and appends 0s to the end to make a byte.
      Returns:
      String[], an array of strings containing all bytes left in the buffer aas strings of 1s and 0s.

    • parseStringAsBinaryByte

      public static java.lang.Integer parseStringAsBinaryByte​(java.lang.String s)
      Static method. Call this method with a string of 1s and 0s to read it as binary to convert it into an integer it represents. The function is undefined for strings of different lenghts than 8 characters. It will always result in a number ranging from 0 to 255.
      Parameters:
      s - , String to be parse.
      Returns:
      Integer, representing number obtained by parsing the string.
